intro: Hydrolea palustris, commonly known as the swamp hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in tropical and subtropical regions. Hydrolea palustris is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support diverse wetland ecosystems.
